meanings.definition: The act of secretly cooperating or conspiring to do something dishonest or illegal.
meanings.sent1: The connivances between the two criminals were finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: The connivances of the corrupt officials led to their downfall.
meanings.sent3: The connivances of the mischievous students made the teacher suspicious.
meanings.sent4: Her connivances with the rival company were like a dark shadow over her reputation.
meanings.sent5: The connivances in the crime ring were as intricate as a spider's web.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending ignorance or unawareness of something that one ought to oppose; tacit encouragement or assent.
meanings.sent1: His connivances with the wrongdoers shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The connivances of the bystanders allowed the theft to happen.
meanings.sent3: The connivances of the cat pretending not to see the mouse were amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her connivances with the noisy neighbors were like silent approval.
meanings.sent5: The connivances of the politician were as clear as day to the public.
